intro: Thelypodium australe, commonly known as the Australian thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its small white or yellowish flowers are followed by spherical fruits that are dispersed by wind. Thelypodium australe is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
